channel.title: Jagex Knows They Fucked Up
channel.description:
[b]13 December 2007 - A Word About Our Updates[/b]
Even though this week has been one of the toughest ever for everyone involved with RuneScape, it has been tough for so much longer than one week. Bots, gold sellers, scammers: these are all problems that both us and you - the players - have had to put up with together in recent months. These occurrences were becoming so frequent that they seriously threatened RuneScape. A solution was needed as soon as possible, so we had to come up with the one thing that would successfully stop real-world traders – stopping unbalanced trade. It will be tough for law-abiding players, but it will also be tough for us, as we will certainly not be gaining money or members with this update. Instead, we are doing this for the good of the game, which is as dear to our hearts as it is to you. Soon, the hard part will be over and done with. The last of our major changes will be made in January and we certainly don’t plan any more hard changes in the foreseeable future. Together, we will deliver an enormous blow to real-world trading, and the game has already seen a dramatic reduction in their numbers. We have always planned to release the real-world trading updates and then improve them further by listening to your feedback. We were also aware that the updates may not have been perfect the first time around, or that they may not have functioned as an ideal replacement for what we have changed or taken away. This is not a reason to roll them back or remove them, but it IS a reason to keep improving them until they DO work as a full replacement. The hard choices we have made are the best ones for the game, and we must not do anything that allow bots, gold sellers or scammers back into the game. What we need to do is build on these first, large steps and use your feedback to make improvements, so that they better fit your needs and activities. We would really like you to make your feelings known, not in a negative manner that offers no potential solutions, but with constructive criticism and suggestions that we can draw ideas from. For example, if something is broken, don't just demand that we put it back to what it was - instead, tell us your ideas to make the new system work. In summary: we would like you to think about how we can make life in RuneScape more enjoyable for you, while ALSO keeping out real-world traders and bots. It’s going to take a lot of patience and effort from all of us. Saying that, we have not been sitting around hoping for you all to come up with ideas. We have been putting together a plan. This is a schedule of ideas for improvements that will build on a number of our changes: the Grand Exchange, new player-killing games (including other dangerous ones), LootShare, Assist System, trades and so many other things that we have introduced to combat real-world trading. We aim to have the most important improvements ready in time for the unbalanced trade removal in January, and to continue adding more throughout the start of next year. We are currently assembling the best ideas from the Forums and our own staff. We will release another newspost early next week, listing the improvements we plan to make to address your concerns.

item.title: Jagex Knows They Fucked Up
item.dc:creator: @bakatool bakatool
item.description:
@bakatool wrote:

they didn’t mess up anything they gave gold a real value like 100k (100,000) is acutally alot of money now it’s like 1MILL, all balancing out. Now players will work on skills to gain money and balance out on income, merchanters get eliminated this all good… how i see it.

Staking 3,000 is like staking 30K since picking up 3 GP of mans to get 3,000 will take a while… but the 15k minute thing I don’t think they should/will keep. But the 3k limit is good enough.

This is something neopets did as well as you see all neopet shops have a suggested value for all items making the game very stable and no money floods.

Read full topic

item.title: Jagex Knows They Fucked Up
item.dc:creator: @exe626 exe626
item.description:
@exe626 wrote:

[quote=“Javacisnotrecognized, post:19, topic:164509”]Adding/changing a trading limit doesn’t matter. You can just give 3K to someone a hundred times.

That would be something fairly easy to script, no?[/quote]They monitor things like that.

item.title: Jagex Knows They Fucked Up
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

exe626:

They’ve already discussed of raising the 3k limit to 10, 50, possibly 100k on the forums. J Mods find the idea intriguing and will know how to monitor it against real world traders(staking 100k on nothing is a bit odd…?). But one of the mods, I forget whom, is all frantic about “What if the other character just uses 100k of his own to keep it secret” - Monitor how many times they duel in a row and who wins the most. The things the people on the forum are talking about seem pretty smart, especially for the intelligence Runescape brings, it is quite astounding. Winning over the mods easily.

Adding/changing a trading limit doesn’t matter. You can just give 3K to someone a hundred times.

That would be something fairly easy to script, no?

Read full topic

item.title: Jagex Knows They Fucked Up
item.dc:creator: @Dizzy Dizzy
item.description:
@Dizzy wrote:

The game will get back on its feet, just give it some time. You can’t have up without down, nor left without right. I hope you get what I mean.

Another logic would be:

You can’t experience the future, if you are dwelling in the past. So just let go of the past and embrace what the future has for you. And that is what I’m doing, because I would like to see the future of this, still, great game.

Read full topic

item.title: Jagex Knows They Fucked Up
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

13 December 2007 - A Word About Our Updates

Even though this week has been one of the toughest ever for everyone involved with RuneScape, it has been tough for so much longer than one week. Bots, gold sellers, scammers: these are all problems that both us and you - the players - have had to put up with together in recent months.

These occurrences were becoming so frequent that they seriously threatened RuneScape. A solution was needed as soon as possible, so we had to come up with the one thing that would successfully stop real-world traders – stopping unbalanced trade. It will be tough for law-abiding players, but it will also be tough for us, as we will certainly not be gaining money or members with this update. Instead, we are doing this for the good of the game, which is as dear to our hearts as it is to you.

Soon, the hard part will be over and done with. The last of our major changes will be made in January and we certainly don’t plan any more hard changes in the foreseeable future. Together, we will deliver an enormous blow to real-world trading, and the game has already seen a dramatic reduction in their numbers.

We have always planned to release the real-world trading updates and then improve them further by listening to your feedback. We were also aware that the updates may not have been perfect the first time around, or that they may not have functioned as an ideal replacement for what we have changed or taken away. This is not a reason to roll them back or remove them, but it IS a reason to keep improving them until they DO work as a full replacement.

The hard choices we have made are the best ones for the game, and we must not do anything that allow bots, gold sellers or scammers back into the game. What we need to do is build on these first, large steps and use your feedback to make improvements, so that they better fit your needs and activities.

We would really like you to make your feelings known, not in a negative manner that offers no potential solutions, but with constructive criticism and suggestions that we can draw ideas from. For example, if something is broken, don’t just demand that we put it back to what it was - instead, tell us your ideas to make the new system work. In summary: we would like you to think about how we can make life in RuneScape more enjoyable for you, while ALSO keeping out real-world traders and bots.

It’s going to take a lot of patience and effort from all of us. Saying that, we have not been sitting around hoping for you all to come up with ideas. We have been putting together a plan. This is a schedule of ideas for improvements that will build on a number of our changes: the Grand Exchange, new player-killing games (including other dangerous ones), LootShare, Assist System, trades and so many other things that we have introduced to combat real-world trading. We aim to have the most important improvements ready in time for the unbalanced trade removal in January, and to continue adding more throughout the start of next year.

We are currently assembling the best ideas from the Forums and our own staff. We will release another newspost early next week, listing the improvements we plan to make to address your concerns.

Read full topic
